summary: Email correspondence between Assistant U.S. Attorney and defense attorney Laura Menninger regarding logistical arrangements for Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team to review physical evidence and highly confidential materials in her criminal case. The emails discuss scheduling evidence review at the Bronx warehouse and 500 Pearl Street courthouse, transportation of evidence, and handling of sensitive materials including nude images.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Lead defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, coordinating evidence review logistics with the prosecution. She represents Maxwell in the criminal case and is negotiating access to evidence.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Defense attorney copied on all correspondence regarding evidence review logistics for Ghislaine Maxwell's case.

persons.name: Christian R Everdell
persons.context: Defense attorney from Cohen & Gresser LLP copied on all correspondence regarding evidence review for Ghislaine Maxwell's case.

persons.name: Bobbi C Sternheim
persons.context: Defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell copied on all correspondence regarding evidence review logistics.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case (US v. Maxwell - 20 Cr. 330), who will be produced to 500 Pearl Street for evidence review with her defense team.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as the source of seized evidence including electronic devices, images, and videos from his residences that are part of the evidence in Maxwell's case.

connections.description: Menninger is the lead defense attorney representing Maxwell in the criminal case, coordinating her access to evidence for defense preparation.
Evidence seized from Epstein's residences is being used in Maxwell's case, indicating their connection in the alleged criminal activity.
Both are defense attorneys working together on Maxwell's case, coordinating evidence review logistics.
Both are defense attorneys involved in Maxwell's case, with Everdell from Cohen & Gresser LLP assisting with the defense.

events.title: Evidence Review Begins at 500 Pearl Street
events.description: Scheduled start of evidence review for Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team at 500 Pearl Street courthouse, with Maxwell present from 9:30am to 4:30pm daily.

events.title: Bronx Warehouse Evidence Review
events.description: Scheduled period for defense team to review evidence at FBI Bronx warehouse, including items excluded from transportation to the courthouse.

events.title: FBI Searches of Epstein Residences
events.description: FBI conducted searches of Jeffrey Epstein's residences in New York and U.S. Virgin Islands, seizing physical evidence and electronic devices used in Maxwell's case.

events.title: Discovery Production of Epstein Images
events.description: Government produced images and videos seized from Epstein's devices to defense, with notification that nude images were designated Highly Confidential.

locations: 26 Federal Plaza, New York, NY (FBI office)
1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY (Southern District of New York)
150 E. 10th Avenue, Denver, CO (Haddon, Morgan & Foreman law office)
Jeffrey Epstein's residences in New York
Jeffrey Epstein's residences in U.S. Virgin Islands
keyFacts: The FBI maintains evidence in a Bronx warehouse at 2350 Lafayette Ave, including items seized from Jeffrey Epstein's residences in 2019.
Approximately 5,507 electronic images and videos designated as 'Highly Confidential' include nude/partially nude images from Epstein's devices, with 2,100 not previously disclosed to defense.
Evidence includes mini-VHS tapes, electronic devices, framed pictures, plaster busts of female torsos, and a stuffed dog seized from Epstein's properties.
Defense team requested ability to bring laptops and cameras into 500 Pearl Street for evidence review, requiring judicial authorization.
The government designated evidence under a Protective Order with 'Confidential' and 'Highly Confidential' categories restricting photography and access.
